text: so I think one of the marketing
campaigns here in the US that's been
very successful for us has been around
uh NFL
sponsorship so we're the official HDTV
of the
NFL and that gives us obviously a good
association with sports which is a big
passion point for consumers here but
we've really Act ated across a number of
different ways but the key there I think
is it's all coming from the passion of
consumers so we went out we've we've
done a lot of research over the years
into why consumers Buy TVs and the
number one sort of purchase driver for
TV is around sports that's what people
want to watch on a big screen TV and
it's very communal you want to have your
friends over enjoy it together and
that's reflected in the the way people
buy TVs so we've done a big campaign
this year with uh our uh large scale TVs
so that you can really understand the
benefits of watching those TVs to enjoy
sports uh and bringing in the NFL and
the the football connection so we were
written up recently in the New York
Times for this as being an example of a
very exciting marketing campaign that's
brought together consumer passion points
together with sort of multi Channel
activation really cool TV commercial but
all of it rooted in the Insight from
consumers that this is what is
Meaningful to them for watching TV again
it's part of this change from just being
a piece of Hardware to being something
that you enjoy a really wonderful
experience and sports now is just
unbelievable on in HD on a large
screen I think what it really says to us
and probably as a techn techology
company we need to learn this lesson
more than any other which is to focus on
what really is a great experience for
consumers so the technology technology
companies like ours it's always easy
just to default to looking at you know
the engineering side of things and this
is cool we can make it thinner and so on
but what is it that consumers really
want and what is it that's going to be
uh just this wonderful experience for
them so you know we spend a lot of money
in Samsung now to look at that wow
experience and even looking at the way
in which people unbox our products there
should be that wow moment when you take
the TV out of its box when you take the
mobile phone out of its box just that
sense of excitement of emotion so it's
really moving from technology to being
about emotional connection and that's
where the marketing campaign comes in
too yeah you know we had products a few
years ago when I was work in Korea where
it was really at the early stages of
convergence so of putting things
together and saying let's take a phone
and let's put a camera basically
together with it and that was like the
first camera phone some years ago and
that notion of just putting things
together really focused on technology
and then pushing it into the market
those things often didn't sell very well
why because consumers didn't really see
a need for them and also because they
sacrificed product so we weren't getting
the best product features and the best
functions that consumers wanted so
sometimes when technology isn't aligned
with where consumers are and it's just
pushing a technology solution to a
problem which they don't feel they have
then that's where I think we we can get
uh we can get in trouble but the more
we're rooted in really understanding
what people are buying what their unmet
needs are what sort of uh goals they
have really from their their products
that's where we can build successful
marketing
